title: Chicken Biryani
description: A fragrant and spicy Indian rice dish made with layers of marinated chicken, basmati rice, and aromatic spices. A festive favorite loved across the world.

items: A few strands of saffron soaked in 3 tbsp warm milk

instructions: Rinse and soak the basmati rice for 30 minutes.
Marinate the chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, chili powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt. Let it sit for at least 1 hour (or overnight in the fridge).
Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the sliced onions until golden brown. Set aside half for layering.
In the same pan, add marinated chicken and cook for 10–15 minutes until partially cooked. Add half the mint and coriander.
In a separate pot, boil water with bay leaves, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and salt. Add soaked rice and cook until 70% done. Drain the water.
In a heavy-bottomed pot, start layering: half the chicken, half the rice, fried onions, mint, coriander, saffron milk, and ghee. Repeat the layers.
Cover the pot with a tight lid or seal with dough. Cook on low heat (dum) for 20–25 minutes.
Let it rest for 10 minutes, then gently fluff the biryani and serve hot with raita or salad.
